column4: I'm a new user to ubuntu, need some help connecting to my work network, anyone know how? (i need to connect to the network because they use a shared IP and i need to get access to my computers desktop via the local IP once in the network)
how do i connect to a work network?
let me explain it a bit more in detail :P

I'm at home and need to connect to the network at my work, i can do this perfectly fine in windows, but want to do it in linux aswell, i need to connect to the network at my work because they use a shared IP, which means i cant just use remote desktop to connect to my computer with that IP, i need to have connection to the network and then use my local IP (the one for my work computer) to connect remotely to the desktop
im not at work, i need to connect remotely
how did it work on windows?
network connections->add a connection to workplace-> connect through vpn. did you do any of that?
i have no idea what vpn is
did you add another network connection in your networks?
nope, and all VPN buttons cant be clicked, they are disabled for some reason
for vpn in network manager you need sudo apt-get install network-manager-vpn
but you did use the local ip of your machine at work, so that means there was some sort of vpn
got error:E: Couldn't find package network-manager-vpn
